meanings.sent1: I was jeeped when I saw a rabbit in the garden!
meanings.sent2: She jeeped when the magician made the coin disappear.
meanings.sent3: The puppy jeeped at the sight of its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected thunderstorm jeeped the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the fireworks jeeped the sleeping cat.

meanings.sent1: He jeeped me into thinking it was my turn to play.
meanings.sent2: The con artist jeeped the old man out of his savings.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox jeeped the crow into dropping the cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her smile jeeped him into believing everything was fine.
meanings.sent5: The fake treasure map jeeped the pirates into a wild goose chase.

meanings.sent1: She felt jeeped when she realized she paid double for the same item.
meanings.sent2: The salesman jeeped the tourists by selling them fake souvenirs.
meanings.sent3: The student felt jeeped after realizing the teacher gave everyone else extra credit.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist jeeped the elderly couple out of their retirement funds.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest mechanic jeeped the customer by charging for unnecessary repairs.
